Reviews.Title: “Well located, very friendly and good value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mad2dance
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased we chose Casa Petrarca for our four night stay in Venice. The location is very central for St Marks Square and for Rialto - both only a few minutes walk away. This meant that if we wished we could easily come back to our room during the day, which we did to get respite from the rain! The casa is small and compact and there is a feeling of the personal touch from the owners who run their inn with their guests interests at heart. The room (number 6) was clean and big enough for two although it had a very small wardrobe and no drawers. We had a small en suite bathroom with a shower. The room was serviced every day. We had no view from the room apart form the building across the narrow street but that was not an issue and were a quiet side of the building so really heard nothing from the street or anywhere else. I found the bed very comfortable and I slept very well. Breakfast was in a small but very quaint room which had a view over a canal an bridge outside. We sat by the window each day and enjoyed watching people coming and going up over the bridge. Breakfast kept me going well into the afternoon. We were given basket of pastries and toast with a range of jam, honey, cheese spread and nutella. There was always a special cake to take a slice of which I very much liked! Freshly hard boiled eggs (still warm) were on offer as were yoghurts and juice. A choice of tea, coffee and hot chocolate was available. The hosts were very welcoming and accommodating and wanted to make sure we had everything we needed. They offered good recommendations for places to go and visit and places to eat and took time to find out information for us about travel details. When we arrived I found the room chilly and could't get the radiator to work but after speaking to Valentina this was sorted out. Large umbrellas were available to borrow by the door and there was a great deal of information available to read about Venice in the way of books, magazines and leaflets. We were grateful for the large map we were given on arrival as the maps we had were quite small and it was hard to read them given the number of tiny streets and alleyways there are in Venice. We really enjoyed our stay and felt very welcome. We would definitely stay in Casa Petrarca when we next visit Venice and I will be recombining it to my friends. I felt that it was good value for money given that Venice is such an expensive place to stay and that it was so central. Thanks you Valentina for a very happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull staff and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sofusden
Reviews.Content: The location for a hotel in Venice could not be better. Right between Rialto and San Marco. Rooms are clean and nice, staff is more than helpfull and prices are low considering Venice pricelevel. Breakfast served in the hotel is ok. Some rooms has a shared bathroom which can be selected when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, very close to main sights!!!”
Reviews.Author: YoungCoupleTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, welcoming staff. Our room was above a busy street but it quietened enough for us to sleep piece-fully. Bed was very comfortable. Room was decorated very nicely, it felt very venetian. Easy walk to main stops. They were accommodating to us, as it was winter and the tide was rising we had to check out very early in the morning, so they has breakfast ready for us to take with us. Shared bathroom, but room had a sink, so you could to a dry wash if you wished. Very clean and enough room for a couple. Recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location...”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to Rialto & San Marco even for an 83 yr old was perfect for our family (even dragging luggage). Our room was quite squishy for 4 of us and initially we were concerned about the noise coming from the canal & footbridge under our window but it soon quietened down at bed time. Beds were comfy and amenities adequate. In house breakfast was great to start the day and more than enough to tide through to a late lunch. The hosts were really helpful and friendly. Highly recommend Casa Patrarca. Visit to Murano glass factory was worth it but products are double+ the price of what you can buy in Venice. Vaporhetto passes were value for money - didn't get charged extra for luggage and made exploring easy. Luna Park was a fun night of entertainment for our 9 yr old son.

Reviews.Title: “So nice”
Reviews.Author: VivianeEduardo
Reviews.Content: great location, between Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. Large room with kitchen, very clean, comfortable beds, quiet., With a great overlook the canal. Bathroom small but clean. Breakfast simple but nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It made my trip to Venice so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: RomeLoverMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Casa Petrarca in 2003 and chose to return here with my husband in September 2011. There is little to fault about this establishment - it is in an excellent location, it is quiet, clean, and the proprietors are simply lovely. Valentina and Stefano were both very friendly and helpful and prepared a tasty continental breakfast for us each morning. The warm croissants were scrumptious! We plan to return to Venice some day and will definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and great accomodation in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Imogene H
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Casa Petrarca was great -we had fantastic service and our room was clean -and so was the shared bathroom. The location was great -and the breakfast was the best included breakfast we had in Italy. We had a great time at the Casa Petrarca.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pamela F
Reviews.Content: Casa Petrarca was recommended by friends and right from the first "Buongiorno" greeting Valentina's warmth shone through. Her enthusiasm and efficiency made our first experience in Venice a truly unforgettable one. The charming hotel, on the first floor, is perfectly located at the end of an alley, 5 mins from San Marco Square and Rialto Bridge - Valentina's map (sent via e-mail) of how to get there was very clear for which we were very grateful. On landing at San Marco by Alilaguna water bus (all helpful details provided by Valentina) - an hour's trip from the airport - we were able to find our way to Casa Petrarca very easily. One tip - don't take big luggage - too many steps up and down - we packed 5 days clothing into a small backpack and that was ideal. In the heat of summer you don't need much - but leave space for shopping! We had a twin share with bathroom - excellent. Valentina's cheerful greeting every morning made us feel very much at home and nothing was too much trouble - right down to breakfast in the room before an early exit. Thank you to Stefano, too. I would heartily recommend this little hotel - very affordable, spotless - a little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice! Stephano and Valentina, the proprietors of Casa Petrarca, could not have been more friendly and accomodating. What a great location to set out and explore Venice from, very centrally located between the Rialto Bridge and St. Marks square. We arrived late on Wed and Valentina had gave us directions on where to find access to the hotel & our room. Loved that the hotel was off on a side street and one of the smaller canals, made it very quiet & charming. Room was petite, but quite functional; a wonderfully comfortable bed, clean functional ensuite bathroom, grateful for the air conditioning as it was quite warm everywhere but in our room, ahhhh!. Breakfast was so nice; cute breakfast room where they ask your preference for coffe or tea and then serve you; fruit filled Croissants, eggs, cheese, toast all very nice and a great way to get started on your days explorations adventures. Your hosts are eager to accomodate your requests, and answer questions. Would highly reccommend and we plan to return

Reviews.Title: “Primo Location and Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we booked this Hotel several months out. We had a three night pre-cruise stay in Venice and were immediately attracted to Casa Petrarca because of the affordability. Turned out to be a great find! Located within 5 minutes to San Marcos and maybe 7 minutes tops to the Rialto Bridge. Stephano and Valentina, the owners, could not be more friendly and accomodating. They booked our tours, water taxi to the ship, and provided us with the information needed to find them for a late arrival. (Valentina even walked us to the hotel where we caught the taxi to make sure it went smoothly). We were provided a wonderful Continental Breakfast each morning. We booked a room ensuite which was clean and perfect for our short stay. Not a large room, but hey, this hotel was built in the 14thy century. Part of the charm. Stephano and Valentina and the Casa Petrarca enriched my magical visit to Venice. I cannot wait to return, and would stay with them in a heart beat. Thanks so much!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venice & Gr8 little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaveenBijoor
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel just 3days before our travel and as a last resort as most of the hotels were either fully booked or way too expensive for our 2 day stay. As such we were pleasantly surprised to find this hotel so good for a very affordable price. We booked a room with sharing bathroom and were concerned about the cleanliness aspect but again were surprised to find it spotlessley clean. Our room was small but adequate. Our host Valentina was simply superb and very accomodating with our every request. Add to this was the location which was very convenient as it was close to all the important attractions.We couldnt have asked for more n had a memorable 2 days. Will definitely visit CASA PETRARCA again. Lastly a big Thank you Valentina!!! You are too good!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,lovely hotel, friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: Vastomole
Reviews.Content: We have been to Venice every year at least once for the last 16 years, and therefore have stayed in many different hotels with different star ratings. This one is classed as a 1 star, but I have stayed in 3 stars, and even 4 in Venice that were no where near as good as this one! The owners were very friendly and helpful, and not at all aloof as some Venetians are! The breakfast room, although very small, had a nice feel to it, niceley decorated and a good view of the canal from the windows at the front. Breakfast was the usual Italian fare of toast, jam, flakes, juice and tea or coffee, but also fresh croissants and yogurts. the rooms are very clean and vary in size but are nicely decorated. Our room had a nice canal view. The hotel is on the first floor, but does have a lift. There are lots of people on the bridge outside the hotel windows which to me is fine as this is Venice and it's a very touristy and busy place, so don't expect peace and quiet. I would highly recommend this hotel for location alone, it's a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Double bed was actually two singles on a double base - not happy”
Reviews.Author: Bel291981
Reviews.Content: To be fair the room was adequate neat and tidy and cleaned every day. What I was not happy with was the fact that the "double bed" was two single matresses on a double base which was extremely uncomfortable and provided for a poor night's sleep. I politely enquired the next morning as to why we had two single mattresses when I specifically booked a double bed to which I was promptly informed that is how they are for all of the rooms. I was not happy and felt that we were ripped off for the money that we paid 110 Euros a night to stay here. We won't be staying here again and won't be reccomending it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: ChiLuvsToTrav
Reviews.Content: Casa Petrarca is a small hotel in the heart of Venice, only a very short walk to Piazza San Marco. We occupied one of the rooms overlooking the canal. The room is very well priced, considering a very good breakfast is included. If you're looking for a spacious, comfortable room, this is not the place for you. Our room had hardly any walking area but the bathroom was big. For a few days stay, Casa Petrarca is great, considering the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Cute”
Reviews.Author: Mon100
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed their for 2 nights. We found the accommodation adequate. We don't tend to spend much time at the hotel so it suited us. We found the service wonderful. Anything we asked for either Valentina or Stefano would do what they could to help us. They both made us feel really welcome. Breakfast was great. Rooms were clean and it was a great, safe location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this little hotel and would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: panacea97
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in the heart of Venice. Stefano and Valentina were wonderful hosts and made our stay very enjoyable. The only advice that I have is to make sure that you understand where you are going and which water bus stop to get off at as it can be very confusing for a newbie in Venice. We got off one stop too early and had to walk with our luggage through Plaza San Marco and over 4 bridges. Thankfully 2 nice policemen escorted us right to the door of the hotel once we asked them for help. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a real look at Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Small and Nice B&B near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: derekthetech
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay during our trip to Italy. By the time we had gotten off the plane and into Venice, we were relieved to find this charming B&B nestled back in a small street not far from the Piazza San Marco. The B&B is located on the first floor (one floor above ground) and Stefano was there to greet us at the door. He welcome us in and gave us a map to help us find our way around the many streets of Venice. The room that we reserved was nothing fancy, and it had all that we needed. A bed, a bureau, and a bathroom. The space was a little tight, but we weren't going to be spending a lot of time there anyways. Stefano and his wife were very accomodating to us, and served a wonderful breakfast. We were trying to do the Italian style breakfast, and the pastries and coffee were excellent. They had more standard breakfast fare as well, including cereal, fruit, and yogurt. The location of the B&B made it a steal for us, as it was close to the major sights, but not so much out in the open on a main road. It might it very nice to be able to get oriented before heading out into the crowds of other tourists. All in all, an excellent place to stay, and the hospitality cannot be matched!

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: Clara02
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for two nights. It is rated a 1 star and I think that is fairly appropriate. The room we had was basic. Double bed, wardrobe, sink with mirror and a chair. Not much to look at. The bed was really uncomfortable, in my opinion, though my partner was fine with it. The room was kind of awkward, as it was tight to get to the side of the bed because there was not much room and, on the one side, the wardrobe was in the way. We had a "shared" bathroom, though it did not seem like any other room would use it to shower in, though it was sort of the reception area's toilet. It was nice and clean, the only downside was having to run down the hallway in your PJs in the morning to have a shower. Breakfast was alright as well. Some juice from a box, toast and jam, fruit, and a few pastries. Staff was very friendly. Overall, quite clean. Location was great, being so close to San Marco's square. Venice is really small, though, so if I went again I think I would stay farther away from San Marco's and stay somewhere a bit nicer for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean and well located apartment”
Reviews.Author: Jacinta26
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience in Venice and our apartment at Casa Petrarca was lovely. Don't be deterred by the one star rating as this was the best apartment we stayed at during our holiday around Europe, and rated better than other 3 and 4 star hotels. The room was clean, spacious and had a lovely view to the canals. The owner Stefano was very hospitable and friendly and gave great tips on where to eat etc. The location of the apartment is very central to the wonderful shops of Venice and also to St Marco's. Breakfast was included daily and was always fresh and delicious. I can highly recommend this apartment and is a credit to it's owner Stefano.

Reviews.Title: “A nice small charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: karinedzhan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Casa Petrarca for six nights, and I guess we could not have chosen a better hotel for our stay in Venice. Location is excellent- just between St. Marco and Rialto, close to vaporetto stops and major sightseeing. The room was nice and clean, bad comfortable, and the bathroom with bath was comfortable too. One of reviewers here recommended:â€� Just ask not to be in the room near the kitchenâ€�. We have been in this room and are very satisfied â€“ noise during preparing breakfast is not loudly and begins, when we anyway do not sleep. The rest of day you hear neither the other guests nor staff, and the only â€œnoiseâ€� is from gondolas and songs: it is just that â€œnoiseâ€�, which we wanted when booking this room with a canal view. You are completely independent, have your own key, can come and go at any time. Breakfast is plenty and tasty, served in a lovely breakfast room with the canal view. Both hosts â€“ Valentine and Stefano -are extremely helpful and, importantly, speak good English. All in all, everything was great: location, breakfast, service and the price. You may find something more fancy for a much higher price, but one hardly can find a host better than Valentina- she is a very warm, friendly and engaged person, doing the best in helping her guests to get as much as possible out of their stay in Venice, recommends sightseeing according to the particular guestâ€™s interest (not just for â€œcommon touristâ€�- for example, for us she kindly reserved tickets for a concert in La Fenice), helps to arrange your stay and find your way around. We felt us being really very welcome and almost like being hosted by a Venetian friend. I would certainly recommend this small charming hotel to my relatives, colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service, Romantic Room”
Reviews.Author: Jarett_16
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to stay for a romantic few days in Venice. We had 2 nights in the delux double room with the windows over the canal. It was really amazing. We had the opportunity to take our breakfast and eat it privately at the little table in the room overlooking the canal which was really special. For the 3rd night, that room was booked, but we were able to take another room at Casa Petrarca. My girlfriend and I were supposed to stay in a smaller room with bunks, but since another double opened up, the managers were nice enough to upgrade us to the double room with shared bathroom at the same original price!!! While not over the water or as large as the delux double which had its own bath, it was fine four our needs on the last night, and very cozy. And were thankful that we could maintain the romantic feel with a double room. For once in Venice, a tourist city for more than 400 years, we felt like we weren't trying to be "nickle and dimed" during our visit. In fact, the feeling was quite the opposite at Casa Petrarca, the managers helped us to mail postcards, gave excellent advise on restaurants, provided us breakfast in the room, etc. I really appreciated this friendly attitude, and would certainly recommend this place to anyone who wants a comfortable, beautiful, and romantic stay in Venice. The place also had free wireless internet for our laptop which was nice to have. Finally, the location really is perfect! Right on a canal, with the entrance off on a quiet little side street. You feel really secure and safe about the things in you room (need 3 keys- outside door, interior door, room door). It is also half way between 2 major areas of interest in Venice- the Rialto Bridge area and Piazza San Marco. We could easily walk to everywhere we wanted to see, and to those out of the way places where you could have the great experience of "getting lost in Venice." To show that this is a totally unbiased review, I will give the single constructive criticism I have: We would have preferred if the shower in the delux room had higher water pressure (but bear in mind that I'm used high pressure shower heads, and a bit of a stickler about this when I'm vacation). It could certainly be acceptable for many people, and is probably more environmentally friendly. Overall, I am confident in saying that you will really enjoy your stay at Casa Petrarca!!!! Enjoy Venice! It's a beautiful city on the water!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: soyee
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the window opens out to a great view of the canal! The location is only around 5 minutes walking distance (provided you don't get lost) to either the Rialto or San Marco station so it's very convenient. The breakfast can be improved upon thou. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great family room in central location”
Reviews.Author: familyoffour009
Reviews.Content: We shared a large room with our daughters (10 and 15) for 3 nights; gorgeous, comfortable accomm in a great location. Valentina and Stefano are great hosts and we'd return in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: mkflgtr
Reviews.Content: The Casa Petrarca was a fantastic value in a fantastic locaton! We enjoyed the hospitality of Stephano and Valentina--very informative and helpful. Their breakfast was fabulous also--always a plus when you have a huge siteseeing day ahead of you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel - close to St Marks”
Reviews.Author: Scot_56
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel which we chose because of its location - it may only be 1 star but don't let that put you off - you get a good price (for Venice where everything is dearer). We were made very welcome and the room was comfortable with a small ensuite. (Space is a premium in Venice so no complaint with that.) The few staff were friendly and offered hints of good restaurants to try, etc The room was well furnished - we did not use the air con as it was not required. The breakfast was good - toast, croissant, jams, yogurt, etc with juice and tea or coffee. The hotel overlooked a canal and so a few gondolas passed but otherwise it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location; great service; right on canal and very well priced!”
Reviews.Author: Hilary80
Reviews.Content: Casa Petrarca was fabulous. We were very lucky and able to book their largest room which was beautiful with parquetry floors, a huge bed and an equally huge bathroom with a bath! You can throw open the windows and let the sounds of Venice drift in...with gondolas drifting right past. Casa Petrarca is in a great location - only minutes from San Marco's square. The breakfast is hot and lovely and although the hotel is small (only seven rooms I think) it has an air of calm about. Housed in a stunning old Venetian building with incredibly cheap prices, the owners are so kind and immediately offer all the assistance they can give, Get Stefano to reccommend dinner venues - we have never eaten so well! All is all - a wonderful, wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: tjanka
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel in great, the owners are very nice, service is good, rooms are clean. Everything was really great. Only bed was too short. You are completly independent, have your own key and you can come and go at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: Marknath
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and staff made you feel very welcome. The room was nice and quiet with a bathroom which had a shower and toilet. We found it quite central to everything and it was easy to get to from the railway station, not far from the Rialto bridge. Lovely breakfast room with some views of the canals, breakfast was included with the room price. The staff bent over backwards to help us, they booked tickets to the Venice Jazz Club (worth a look) over the phone for us which was really nice. If you are looking for a place to stay check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “so extremely friendly and helpful, really looked after us”
Reviews.Author: 2512anthony_d
Reviews.Content: Hi, We were on our honeymoon and after a long drive from Florence via Padua to Venice we finally arrived at Venice. On leaving the car park we realised we had left our passports in Florence.... aggghhh. We called Valentina ( host & owner of Casa Petrarca which we had booked earlier that day) and she immediatley called the hotel in Florence to confirm they had our passports, had copies faxed to her so we could still stay in Venice and then gave us great advice on how to find her ( there was also a water ferry strike that day too!! ). Thankyou Valentina for making us feel so welcome, calming me on arrival after the passport debacle telling us all the local tips on how to have the best stay in Venice on such limited time ( had to go back to Florence the next day to get passports ) as our stay was cut short. Room was very clean and quiet and airconditioned and a peek view of the canals from our window, Beautiful city, great accomodation, very lovely host. Oh, and great coffee at breakfast! Thanks again, Rachel & Anthony - Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mymlania_m
Reviews.Content: The service I exdperienced was very good. The room was nice and clean. The location was close to shops and restaurants. What I liked best was everyting, nothing was less good. Everything was great: location, breakfast, service and the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Petrarca
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 4394 - Calle de le Schiavine, 30100 Venice, Italy
